learning_units.name: Introduction to Digital Sustainability
learning_units.description: Core sustainability concepts and their intersection with technology systems for digital professionals
learning_units.extended_description: This 0.5 ECTS foundational learning unit introduces digital professionals to core sustainability concepts and their intersection with technology systems. Participants will explore how digital technologies impact environmental outcomes and learn practical approaches to sustainable technology practices. Key topics include digital carbon footprinting, energy-efficient system design, sustainable software development principles, and the role of digitalization in achieving organizational sustainability goals. The learning unit combines theoretical frameworks with hands-on exercises, enabling participants to identify sustainability opportunities within digital workflows and implement environmentally responsible technology practices. Designed for developers, system administrators, IT managers, and digital professionals seeking to integrate sustainability considerations into their technical work.
topics: Digital sustainability fundamentals and core concepts
Environmental impact assessment of digital technologies
Digital carbon footprinting methodologies and tools
Data center sustainability and cloud efficiency

subject_specific_competences.knowledge: Demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of digital sustainability theories, carbon footprinting methodologies, energy efficiency metrics, and lifecycle assessment frameworks as applied to technology systems.
subject_specific_competences.skills: Apply analytical tools to assess environmental impact of digital technologies using established frameworks and evaluate opportunities for sustainable technology implementation.
subject_specific_competences.competences: Integrate digital sustainability principles into organizational contexts, designing energy-efficient systems and implementing practices that achieve measurable environmental improvements.

legacy_format.knowledge: Identify and categorize fundamental digital sustainability concepts including carbon footprinting methodologies, energy efficiency metrics, and lifecycle assessment frameworks as applied to technology systems and organizational workflows.
legacy_format.understanding: Analyze the quantifiable environmental impact of digital technologies using established assessment frameworks and evaluate opportunities for sustainable technology implementation within specific organizational contexts.
legacy_format.skills: Calculate digital carbon footprints using industry-standard tools, design energy-efficient system architectures, and implement sustainable software development practices that measurably reduce environmental impact by at least 15%.

components.description: Weekly knowledge checks with immediate feedback
Carbon footprint calculation and system design exercises
Individual presentation on sustainability implementation strategy

EQF_descriptors.knowledge: Comprehensive, specialized knowledge within digital sustainability field with awareness of knowledge boundaries
EQF_descriptors.skills: Comprehensive range of cognitive and practical skills required to develop creative solutions to abstract sustainability problems
EQF_descriptors.responsibility: Exercise management and supervision in work or study contexts where there is unpredictable change

learning_units.name: Introduction to EU Sustainability Legislation
learning_units.description: Practical knowledge of European Union sustainability regulations affecting business operations
learning_units.extended_description: This 1 ECTS learning unit provides professionals with practical knowledge of European Union sustainability regulations affecting business operations. Participants will examine key legislation including the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD), Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation (SFDR), EU Taxonomy Regulation, and related digital sustainability requirements. The learning unit covers essential compliance frameworks, materiality assessment processes, and reporting obligations through structured learning activities. Designed for self-paced learning, it serves sustainability managers, business analysts, consultants, and professionals who need to understand regulatory requirements and implementation strategies. Upon completion, participants will be equipped to support organizational compliance efforts and navigate the evolving EU regulatory landscape.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of business operations and organizational structure
Awareness of European Union institutional framework and legislative processes
Familiarity with sustainability concepts and corporate reporting principles
Completion of Introduction to Digital Sustainability (LU1) or equivalent competences

subject_specific_competences.knowledge: Demonstrate comprehensive, specialized knowledge of EU sustainability legislation (CSRD, SFDR, EU Taxonomy) including regulatory frameworks, compliance obligations, and interconnections between directives within defined boundaries.
subject_specific_competences.skills: Apply analytical frameworks to complex regulatory scenarios, develop creative compliance solutions, and synthesize cost-benefit assessments for organizational decision-making within established parameters.
subject_specific_competences.competences: Design and implement comprehensive compliance strategies that integrate multiple regulatory requirements and demonstrate organizational regulatory readiness, managing complex activities in unpredictable regulatory environments.

generic_competences: Analytical and critical thinking within specialized domains

legacy_format.knowledge: Distinguish between CSRD, SFDR, and EU Taxonomy requirements, identifying specific compliance obligations, reporting timelines, and materiality thresholds applicable to organizations of different sizes and sectors.
legacy_format.understanding: Evaluate the strategic implications of EU sustainability legislation for business operations, including cost-benefit analysis of compliance approaches and assessment of regulatory risk exposure.
legacy_format.skills: Develop comprehensive compliance implementation plans including materiality assessment matrices, stakeholder engagement protocols, and monitoring frameworks that demonstrate organizational regulatory readiness within 12-month implementation timelines.

components.description: Written analysis of regulatory compliance scenario
Comprehensive compliance implementation plan with supporting documentation
Viva voce on regulatory strategy and implementation

EQF_descriptors.knowledge: Comprehensive, specialized knowledge within EU sustainability legislation with awareness of knowledge boundaries
EQF_descriptors.skills: Comprehensive range of cognitive and practical skills required to develop creative solutions to abstract regulatory problems
EQF_descriptors.responsibility: Exercise management and supervision in contexts where there is unpredictable change in regulatory environments
